list_definition.definition: a small part added to the end of a word that changes the meaning, for example ’-ness’ at the end of ’goodness’ or ’-ly’ at the end of ’quickly’.

list_ex_of_english: Such changes are lexically determined and not restricted to grammatical suffixes and particles.
Since regular suffixes may follow certain unstressable suffixes, a loop must be introduced, as shown below.
Both of these suffixes are obligatory, and show respect for those higher up on the social-stratification ladder.
English uses the -s suffix on verbs when the subject is singular in the third person, but not first or second person.
Emergence of suffixes, including their phonological behavior, should be influenced by frequency of occurrence in the input.
Let us now consider why it suffices to recognize just one verbal suffix that forms participles.
For this verb, the perfect suffix /-a/ must be used, regardless of the number of surface vowels in the word.
Note that not every predicate lacking the causative component in its meaning is able to inherit this property from the suffix.
